Sometimes all you can do is find a silver lining in an unfortunate situation. This morning while cleaning sidewalks we had a piece of equipment hit the glass in one of our exterior doors. This was a door that we added security film to this summer. When installed the film is supposed to keep glass in place if someone tries to violently break through in an effort to enter the building.

It works! As you can see from the pictures, the window shattered but still stayed strongly in place. This accident gave us first hand evidence that the measures taken to enhance the safety and security of our students was effective.

The glass and film will be replaced ASAP and now we know, IT WORKS! #brookvillestrong #safetyandsecurity #silverlining #itworks #keepcalmandfixit #ibleedblue @ Brookville Middle School

post_text:
11th in the State!!!
Newspaper Gives Brookville Schools Lofty Ranking...

School District Report Card outcomes are often very predictable by the level of income in a community. Students in more affluent districts generally score very well and low income districts often struggle producing high marks. So, the Cleveland Plain Dealer gave a shoutout today to districts that “overperform” when you match the Report Card results with the community median income. Districts were recognized for beating the economic trends with their district grades. Under the formula used to match our Report Card results with our median income Brookville’s Report Card ranked 11th out of 608 Ohio school districts! Our students and staff are to be commended for such awesome results.
See the report here: https://www.cleveland.com/news/g66l-2019/09/2280878c3e2692/ranking-every-ohio-school-district-adjusted-for-income-with-2019-report-card-grades.html
